title: restore passwords
content: Hi, I lost all my passords in firefox trying to sync iphone and Laptop. I had to setup an new iphone (13 Mini) from an ICloud backup. But somehow in the firefox-app under passwords I got all the websites, but no login and password safed. So I deleted all this information on the iphone, since I still got all the data on my laptop. I startet sync, but what happend was, that it somehow synced the other way around and all the Pw an the laptop disappeared. Of course I didn't make a backup before. Any chance to restore these data? At the moment I could restore the data on the Iphone from an Iphone-backup. But now the sync works properly and always deletes the data on the Iphone. Any chance to transfere these data from the Iphone to the laptop apart from wrighting them manually? Kindly Georg
creator: georg_kirchner

title: Não consigo usar o navegador Firefox desde ontem
content: Desde ontem,dia,08/01/2024 não estou conseguindo usar o Navegador Firefox,pois não abre nenhuma página. É a primeira vez que isso acontece,desde que comecei navegar na internet há anos atrás. Preciso de ajuda para saber o que está acontecendo e como resolver o problema. Desde já eu agradeço.
creator: moninha75sl

creator: josesleiman16

title: How to fix slim / narrow / barely visible scroll bar?
content:
My mother is in her seventies and uses a laptop I purchased for her with Windows 10. Microsoft apparently auto-updated her to Windows 11, and now not only is the whole OS different but the scroll bars on everything are so thin that you can barely click on them to drag. They only get fractionally thicker when you hover over them with the cursor. This is not specific to any website.

The issue exists in both Windows and Firefox on her machine since the update, for some reason. She and I both have the latest edition of Firefox, but I am still running Win 10. I managed to find a registry edit to improve the scroll bar in Windows File Manager for her, but this had no impact on the scroll in Firefox. Is there a way to fix this? I could not find a setting for it.

I have attached a side-by-side screen shot of her scroll in Firefox on Google, before and during hover with cursor. I have also included a screen shot of my scroll in Firefox on Reddit, which looks as hers did before the update and is much more user-friendly.
creator: wynden

title: chat.openai.com > this page is slowing down Firefox error.
content:
Hello, I've started to experience an error message for a few weeks now.

When I interact with this website : chat.openai.com I get an error for 'This page is slowing down Firefox. To speed up your browser, stop this page.'

The website is not responding, and doesn't let me to further interact with it.

In process manager the CPU usage is 100%, while the website is not responding.

The odd thing is that when I check the CPU usage in Task Manager, remains steady at 15% .. 16% .. 17% but never 19% (while using this specific website of course).


I tried through incognito, and it does the same.

If someone of you friends, can suggest something different. Please let me know.

Best regards, George
creator: b_georgestefan

title: Suddenly my right-side screen sidebar offering internet choices is missing
content: Missing my right-side screen sidebar internet choice (I still have left-side bookmarks)

title: I want to Close Password Manager at times during the day
content:
Is there a way to "close" password manager? It stays on when I hibernate, so it's not secure to walk away.

It "opens" when I enter my "Master" PW. Nice. But I cannot command it to "Close" during my session. I have to Shut Down in order to turn off PW Manager and have a secure computer. This is not something that is convenient for me.

Password manager stays on when I Hibernate. Or Sleep.
creator: abbey2
